snippet: Groups not affiliated with any political party have produced a blizzard of advertisements, and under state campaign-finance laws, such organizations’ origins can remain mysterious.
abstract: Searing advertisements financed by independent groups with murky ties, including some not even based in New York, are shaping State Senate races in Queens, Westchester County and Rochester;  the most forceful of the attack advertisements have been concentrated in a handful of races that will determine which party controls the chamber.
lead_paragraph: Groups not affiliated with any political party have produced a blizzard of advertisements, and under state campaign-finance laws, such organizations’ origins can remain mysterious.

headline.seo: 3 New York Senate Races Flooded by Money from Outside Groups
headline.main: Attack Ads, by Outside Groups With Murky Ties, Shape 3 New York Senate Races
headline.print_headline: Attack Ads, by Outside Groups With Murky Ties, Shape 3 New York Senate Races
